exclusion:
1. Make sure the HEM G2 is powered, its LED be light on steadily.
  2. Let the primary controller of existing Z-Wave network into remove mode (If you don’t know how to do this, refer to its manual).
  3. Press the Z-Wave button.
  4. If exclusion success, HEM G2 LED will blink slowly or its LED still be on, please repeat the process from step 2.
inclusion:
1. Connect HEM G2 to power and install the device properly (according to the Installation instruction, if necessary, please ask an electrician for help) , at beginning its LED blink slowly.
  2. Let the primary controller of existing Z-Wave network into inclusion mode (If you don’t know how to do this, refer to its manual).
  3. Press the Z-Wave button of HEM G2.
  4. If learning success, HEM G2 LED will stop slow blink, or it will still slow blink, please repeat the process from step 2.
label: DSB28
overview:
Aeon Labs Home Energy Meter is a kind of energy meter for the entire home electric power consumption. It can report immediate wattage and kWh and voltage and amperage usage of the AC mains to a Z-Wave gateway wirelessly.

It can send Z-Wave REPORTS (Meter v3 Command Class) to response Z-Wave GET command at any time.

HEM can also be configured as sending unsolicited reports periodically to the associated nodes (within an association group). The time interval of reports can also be configured HEM can also send report of each individual channel with corresponding current clamp via the command of “Multi Channel Command Class Encapsulation ”.

To reduce the network traffic, HEM can send reports only when the loads significant change occurred(by percentage or Wattage value change, which can be configured)
usage:
Reset HEM G2 to factory Default:

  1. Make sure HEM G2 has been connected to the power supply.
  2. Press and hold the Z-wave button for 10 seconds.
  3. If HEM G2 LED blinks slowly, it indicates reset success, otherwise please repeat step 2.

Note:

Reset HEM G2 to factory default Settings will: sets the HEM G2 to not in Z-Wave network state; delete the Association setting, power measure value and restore the Configuration Settings to the default.

channels.name: config_decimal
channels.label: Reporting Interval- Group 1
channels.overview: Change the reporting interval to reduce network traffic during off hours

parameters.label: Reverse clamping
parameters.description: If the reverse clamping pliers, negative power is detected.

parameters.label: Selective Reporting
parameters.description: Report only when power change reaches a threshold set in 4-11 below.
parameters.overview:
Enable selective reporting only when power change reaches a certain threshold or percentage set in 4-11 below.

This is used to reduce network traffic.(Bit 0: Whole HEM ,Bit 1:Clamp 1,Bit 2:Clamp 2,Bit 3:Clamp 3)

Note this will only reduce reporting for Watts. Reports for Volts, Amps, and kWh will be sent with every report (default 5 seconds for report group 1)

parameters.label: Power Threshold - Whole HEM
parameters.description: Threshold change in power to induce an automatic report (Whole HEM).
parameters.overview: Threshold change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Whole HEM). (Valid values 0-60000)

parameters.label: Power Threshold - Clamp 1
parameters.description: Threshold change in power to induce an automatic report (Clamp 1)
parameters.overview: Threshold change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Clamp 1). (Valid values 0-60000)

parameters.label: Power Threshold - Clamp 2
parameters.description: Threshold change in power to induce a automatic report (Clamp 2).
parameters.overview: Threshold change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Clamp 2). (Valid values 0-60000)

parameters.label: Power Threshold - Clamp 3
parameters.description: Threshold change in power to induce an automatic report (Clamp 3).
parameters.overview: Threshold change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Clamp 3). (Valid values 0-60000)

parameters.label: Percent Change - Whole HEM
parameters.description: Percentage change in power to induce an automatic report (Whole HEM).
parameters.overview: Percentage change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Whole HEM). (Valid values 0-100)

parameters.label: Percent Change - Clamp 1
parameters.description: Percentage change in power to induce an automatic report (Clamp 1).
parameters.overview: Percentage change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Clamp 1). (Valid values 0-100)

parameters.label: Percent Change - Clamp 2
parameters.description: Percentage change in power to induce a automatic report (Clamp 2).
parameters.overview: Percentage change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Clamp 2). (Valid values 0-100)

parameters.label: Percent Change - Clamp 3
parameters.description: Percentage change in power to induce a automatic report (Clamp 3).
parameters.overview: Percentage change in wattage to induce a automatic report (Clamp 3). (Valid values 0-100)

parameters.label: Reports  for group 1
parameters.overview:
1 - kWh (whole meter)

2 - Watts (whole meter)

4 - Volts (whole meter)

8 - Amps (whole meter)

256 - Watts (clamp 1)

512 - Watts (clamp 2)

1024 - Watts (clamp 3)

2048 - kWh (clamp 1)

4096 - kWh (clamp 2)

8192 - kWh (clamp 3)

65536 - Volts (clamp 1)

131072 - Volts (clamp 2)

262144 - Volts (clamp 3)

524288 - Amps (clamp 1)

1048576 - Amps (clamp 2)

2097152 - Amps (clamp 3)

e.g. to report kWh, Watts, Volts, and Amps for this report group, enter 15 (1+2+4+8).

Note: selective reporting only works for Watts. It's recommended to set 1 report group for Watts only with a short report period (the default for group 1 is 5 seconds), and 1 report group for other values with a longer report period (the default for groups 2 and 3 is 12 minutes)

parameters.label: Interval to send out reports of group 1
Interval to send out reports of group 2
Interval to send out reports of group 3
Factory Reset
parameters.description: Reset all settings to factory defaults
parameters.overview: If you upgrade firmware and are seeing crazy or impossible numbers, reset to factory then reconfigure unit.
